verbs.description: [ARG0: it] [V: looks] [ARG1: simple] but it not complexity of transbay transit center raises risks san francisco new transit center has a clean unified look with a rippling white form that rests atop clusters of diagonal columns in reality it three buildings in one that stretch for 1 500 feet and twice span major roadways those spans are supported by just four massive beams two of them have cracked the cracks were discovered tuesday and prompted the closure of the 2 16 billion structure for safety reasons while it is too early to determine the cause of the fissures the fact that they exist is a reminder of how complex this simple - looking structure actually is dumbarton oaks john king founder twitter city hall washington johnkingsfchron san francisco principal transbay transit center jking sfchronicle com urban landscape studies tipping structural engineers greg deierlein stanford university thornton tomassetti transbay joint powers authority david friedman fremont maffei structural engineering berkeley kurtis alexander pelli clark pelli architects staff writer steel salesforce tower d c joe maffei leo panian professor the chronicle san francisco chronicle pulitzer prize forell elsesser engineers
